column4: I followed this (http://wiki.cchtml.com/index.php/Ubuntu_Dapper_Installation_Guide#Method_2:_Generating.2FInstalling_Ubuntu_packages_for_the_new_8.29.6_drivers_in_Ubuntu_Dapper_Manually) exactly, yet it still won't work!
Anyone here know how to get ATi drivers working? :(
have you install the driver?
As I said, I followed http://wiki.cchtml.com/index.php/Ubuntu_Dapper_Installation_Guide#Method_2:_Generating.2FInstalling_Ubuntu_packages_for_the_new_8.29.6_drivers_in_Ubuntu_Dapper_Manually exactly.
why install them manually?
yes, but why?
Why did you use this guide rather than install the ubuntu built drivers?
So is the problem the fglrx drivers or WoW?
I've no idea.  I start WoW, and it crashes soon after.
Ah I get you
Ubuntu have the official ATI drivers in the repos
install them rather than the ones that come be default
use synaptic
apt-get install xorg-driver-fglrx
then edit the ` driver     "ati"`  to read `driver          "fglrx"` in /etc/x11/xorg.conf
how are you running WoW?
you could.  I think that does what you need
the problem with WoW is hard to trouble shoot with out knowing the symptoms
If the problem is just poor graphics performance then installing and configuring fglrx should fix it
Apparently, 8.29.6 drivers are the only ones which work for the x1900...
ah ok
